intro: Chloraea laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered chloraea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a distinctive aromatic scent. The flowers, which are usually white or pale yellow, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators.
